page.title: 07Thorpe Salvin - Family Life.
page.content: My real day starts at 8.30am when the school bus collects the children to go to{Todwick School}and my husband leaves for work. I have until 3.45pm to myself when the children are delivered home. Living in a small village it is easy to feel lonely and remote, your own effort determines the day. I usually do my housework as quickly as possible and check that my elderly widower neighbour is all right. I shop twice a week by car in Worksop or{Sheffield.}A butcher,baker and greengrocer come regularly. The Sub Post-Office has just closed so we have to go to the next village for pensions, family allowance or even a stamp.The main social events are meeting village friends for tea or coffee, but the children have to go outside the village for{Brownies}or Cubs or{Swimming.}A car is essential.
